titleInfo.title: Photograph of young adult man and young child, circa 1880s

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: A traditional black and white studio photograph in cabinet card style taken at Cottage Gallery in downtown Memphis. This is likely a rural African American family getting a professional photograph made. It depicts a young adult man dressed in a suit with his arm around a young girl. She is standing on a table in a dress. The Cottage Gallery was a Victorian era photography studio run by Charles Gebhardt, a German immigrant to Memphis. It operated from 1877-1906 at various locations. On the back of the cabinet card is the embossed description "Cottage Gallery: 49 and 51 Beale St. / Ladies Entrance: 2 and 4 Mulberry St. / Memphis Tenn. / Negatives Preserved." Handwritten above the embossing is the name "Salley Walker Oxley." It is not known if Salley Walker Oxley is one of the sitters or a relation to the sitters.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
